title: Node
description: A node in the node hierarchy.  When the node contains `skin`, all `mesh.primitives` must contain `JOINTS_0` and `WEIGHTS_0` attributes.  A node can have either a `matrix` or any combination of `translation`/`rotation`/`scale` (TRS) properties. TRS properties are converted to matrices and postmultiplied in the `T * R * S` order to compose the transformation matrix; first the scale is applied to the vertices, then the rotation, and then the translation. If none are provided, the transform is the identity. When a node is targeted for animation (referenced by an animation.channel.target), only TRS properties may be present; `matrix` will not be present.

camera.description: The index of the camera referenced by this node.

children.description: The indices of this node's children.

skin.description: The index of the skin referenced by this node.
skin.gltf_detailedDescription: The index of the skin referenced by this node. When a skin is referenced by a node within a scene, all joints used by the skin must belong to the same scene.

matrix.description: A floating-point 4x4 transformation matrix stored in column-major order.
matrix.gltf_detailedDescription: A floating-point 4x4 transformation matrix stored in column-major order.
matrix.gltf_webgl: `uniformMatrix4fv()` with the transpose parameter equal to false

mesh.description: The index of the mesh in this node.

rotation.description: The node's unit quaternion rotation in the order (x, y, z, w), where w is the scalar.

scale.description: The node's non-uniform scale, given as the scaling factors along the x, y, and z axes.

translation.description: The node's translation along the x, y, and z axes.

weights.description: The weights of the instantiated Morph Target. Number of elements must match number of Morph Targets of used mesh.
